intro: Telis orthoceras, commonly known as the common orthoceras, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Telis orthoceras is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and drought tolerance.
